FAMILIES WITH KINDERGARTEN THROUGH SECOND GRADERS:

From today's email from Dr. Henderson:

We are making preparations for e-learning in the event that our school closures extend past April 3. We want you to have your child's Chromebook, log in information as well as additional paper resources and workbooks our teachers have prepared.

We will be having drive through pick up tomorrow, Friday, March 20 from 9 a.m. until 12 p.m. Please use the following process:

Place a piece of paper in your passenger window with your child's name and teacher name. A staff member will walk out your child's materials. Our staff will be wearing gloves.

If you have friends or neighbors who are not able to come during the pick up time and you are picking up for them, please also put a piece of paper with that child's name and teacher.

Thank you for your continued support and flexibility.

Sincerely,
Dr. Mary Henderson, Superintendent

July 1, 2019

Dear families and community members of Roselle School District 12,

It is with tremendous honor and pride that I begin my superintendency in Roselle. As I enter my twenty-third year in education, I have had the privilege of serving the communities of Palatine, Naperville and, most recently, Elmhurst. Along the way I have worked with dedicated and committed educators and families, all striving to provide the best educational opportunities to students. I am looking forward to the same type of collaboration in Roselle!

My role as Mom continues to be the most important, even as my three children have moved into adulthood. My experiences as a parent have shaped and informed me as an educator, and keeping that parent perspective in mind has served me well when working to serve our students.

I am looking forward to getting to know our families and community members over the next few months. I know that August will come quickly, and I look forward to having our students back and continuing on our Path to Excellence.

Sincerely,
Dr. Mary Henderson
